actions.text: Amendment SA 1383 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 48 - 50. Record Vote Number: 89.

Amendment SA 1383 proposed by Senator Young to Amendment SA 891. (consideration: CR S1242-1243; text: CR S1242) To strike the provision establishing the Emergency Federal Employee Leave Fund and appropriate $300,000,000 for chemical screening devices for U.S. Customs and Border Protection.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 1383 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 48 - 50. Record Vote Number: 89.
Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 1383 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 48 - 50. Record Vote Number: 89.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1383 proposed by Senator Young to Amendment SA 891.

purpose: To strike the provision establishing the Emergency Federal Employee Leave Fund and appropriate $300,000,000 for chemical screening devices for U.S. Customs and Border Protection.
